H0.text: Magnetism is what causes an object to fall to the ground when you let it drop from your hand.

H1.text: Gravity is the force that causes an object to fall to the ground when you let it drop from your hand.

H2.text: Air resistance causes an object to fall to the ground when you let it drop from your hand.

H3.text: The push from your hand causes an object to fall to the ground when you let it drop from your hand.

A4.text: Near the surface of the Earth, an object in free fall in a vacuum will accelerate at approximately 9.8 m/s2, independent of its mass.

A5.text: In the absence of air resistance, all objects experience the same acceleration due to gravity.
